author: nico_sz
content:
Trying to be a validator, I'm waiting to be processed by the beacon chain (since 5hours)
https://beaconchain.merge-devnet-2.wenmerge.dev/validator/940e9c65ca3c7fe17ea8977994aeb5a336a545b4197e67612c14ac6c4957ace2e43c1353d19d1ab6780705094189a0d2#deposits

https://sznicolas.github.io/sysadmincrypto//ethereum/node/2021/12/05/staking-merge-devnet.html

author: ryg9705
content: <@!801522834023120919> Looks good. I spun up 3 validators as well 2 days ago.  I forked the eth2-deposit-cli for it and created a new option for the --chain parameter for this devnet. I also wanted to fork the launchpad and run it locally with a custom environment template which you can easily define but ran into issue building it due to some errors around the sha3 dependencies. Maybe my nodejs version is incompatible.  In the end used ethabi-cli to create the hex data for the function call manually. Your approach seems easier.

author: parithosh
content:
This is awesome guys! 
I've been using a combination of eth2-val-cli and ethereal to perform deposits. But I was testing to get a combination of ethdo + ethereal to see if it's easier to use. 

I think a forked eth2-deposit cli might be the least friction since so many guides already describe how to use it. Would you mind linking it or writing something up so we can point people to it?

author: parithosh
content: I think you can generate the data with your forked eth2-deposit-cli and submit it with ethereal

author: ryg9705
content: Yes let me publish the code for the deposit-cli. Still don't know why I can't build the launchpad since this was also pretty trivial to change to support a different network. Wanted to throw the static files onto a GCP storage account to host it.

author: ryg9705
content: Aren't we about to launch devnet-3 this week which would come with a new chain-id? Then it might make sense to wait.

author: ryg9705
content: I also tried to spam the network a bit but for some reason was only able to get a few thousand transactions in. https://explorer.merge-devnet-2.wenmerge.dev/address/0x6767d3e0146098F53F617B87bC197A1cBF5027da/transactions I unlocked my account in geth and put the sendTransaction JSON-RPC call into an infinite loop and sent some 100.000 transactions. It filled the next 1-2 blocks with my ETH transfers but then didn't mine any more of my transactions. Tried different gas prices and gas settings. A lot showed in the explorer as "pending" but were never included.Does the mempool expire transactions after some time?
